title: TC001-Project Creation with Valid Inputs
description: Verify that a user can successfully create a new project by providing valid name and description, and is redirected to the dashboard.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Input valid project name and description
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid project name
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('my-awesome-project')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input valid project description
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/textarea').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('This project will automate testing of AI coding agents.')
        

        # -> Correct the project name to valid format and submit the form

description: Check that invalid project inputs trigger proper validation errors and prevent submission.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Clear project name input, fill description, and attempt to submit the form to check validation error for empty project name.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Clear the project name input field to leave it empty.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Fill the description field with valid text.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/textarea').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('This is a test project description.')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the submit button to attempt form submission with empty project name.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Input a valid project name, clear the description field, and attempt to submit the form to check validation error for empty description.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input a valid project name.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('my-awesome-project')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Clear the description field to leave it empty.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/textarea').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the submit button to attempt form submission with empty description.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Project Name *').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Description *').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Fill in project description and create project to navigate to dashboard.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input project description
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/textarea').nth(0)

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to lint quality section of dashboard
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Create Project & Start Discovery' button to create a project and proceed
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Fill the Description field with a valid description and submit the form to create the project and navigate to lint quality section.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Fill the Description field with a valid project description
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/textarea').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('This project will analyze code quality and lint errors to improve software maintainability.')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Create Project & Start Discovery' button to submit the form after filling Description
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Linting Passed Successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The lint results table did not display lint errors and warnings with proper badges and styling as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC021-Review Findings List with Severity Badges
description: Verify ReviewFindingsList displays findings with 5 severity levels, 6 category icons, file paths, line numbers, and suggestions.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3000", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Fill in project name and description, then click 'Create Project & Start Discovery' to proceed to the review results panel.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input project name
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('testproject')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input project description
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/textarea').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('This project is for testing review findings display.')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Create Project & Start Discovery' button
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=No Critical Severity Found').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: The ReviewFindingsList did not display findings with all 5 severity levels, 6 category icons, file paths, line numbers, and suggestions as required by the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
